title: AI summit statement delayed to ‘maximise’ signatories, says India
content: "There is huge consensus on the declaration. We are just trying to maximise the number," India's IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told reporters

title: Allahabad HC quashes case against two students booked for reading namaz at restricted site
content: A court in Sant Kabir Nagar had taken cognisance of the alleged offences and issued a summoning order against the two students in May 2019

title: Simultaneous elections are essential to become a developed nation by 2047: Chaudhary
content: Electoral reform is needed, and simultaneous polls is an issue of national interest, says the chairperson of the Joint Parliamentary Committee examining the Bill on concurrent elections; political ideologies, the BJP MP adds, will have to be set aside for it, and it is not a reform that the BJP alone is pushing for

title: Maharashtra’s Ladki Bahin Yojana: Waiting for ₹1,500
content: The Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana was rolled out ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections in mid-2024. It assured women between the ages of 21 and 65 a monthly stipend of ₹1,500, and the first tranche of payouts were made. After the Mahayuti government returned to power, it introduced mandatory e-KYC verification, which led to a reduction in the number of eligible beneficiaries, reports Vinaya Deshpande Pandit

title: CPI(M)’s Md Salim says there is no lobby in the party as estranged leader Pratik Ur Rahaman raises questions about lobbying and favouritism
content: The senior CPI(M) leader avoided any direct questions about the estranged leader amid the political buzz of Rahaman joining the ruling Trinamool Congress

title: Haryana Governor Ghosh says crimes against women decreased by 16% in 2025
content: The Governor said that the crime against women in respect of the Scheduled Castes has been declining for the last 4-5 years

title: MNS Chief Raj Thackeray stresses need for constructive Opposition, reaches out to ruling dispensation
content: Raj Thackeray, who met the Shiv Sena leader a day earlier, said his outreach was driven purely by civic concerns and not political realignment

title: U.P. court sentences ex-junior engineer, wife to death for sexual exploitation of 33 children
content: The POCSO court termed the crimes as "rarest of rare" and held Ram Bhawan and his wife Durgawati guilty of systematically abusing children between 2010 and 2020

title: Amid SIR exercise, Home Ministry notifies another panel to clear pending CAA applications in West Bengal
content: “This is an additional committee that will process and fast-track CAA applications in the State,” says a government  source; many applications have come from Matuas

title: Music festival pays tributes to saint Thyagaraja
content: More than 200 artists are participating in the event. Sunday will see a ceremonial procession being taken out at 8 a.m., followed by rendering of the famed ‘Pancharatna Kritis’

title: Allahabad High Court states U.P. Police FIRs ‘borrowed from movie scripts,’ gives relief to accused
content: Expressing serious concern over the manner in which an FIR was drafted by the Bahraich police, the Division Bench pointed out a significant inconsistency in the timeline recorded in the same

title: Central library at Amaravati will reflect AP’s history and culture, says HRD Minister Nara Lokesh
content: HRD Minister discusses use of AI tutors in government schools, development works at schools, evaluation of Class X examination answer scripts

title: Safeguarding environment is a shared responsibility, says APPCB chief
content: Krishnaiah calls for a transition of A.P. from a linear economy to a more sustainable circular economy

title: Modi holds talks with top leaders of Mauritius, Sri Lanka, and Slovakia
content: PM also held a meeting with UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres and discussed how the global body can play a "constructive role" in making use of artificial intelligence inclusive

title: As two of the world’s largest democracies and dynamic economies, India and Brazil cannot remain distant: President Lula
content: Bilateral trade between Brazil and India reached its highest level in 2025, but it remains far below its true potential, says the Brazilian President

title: PM Modi stressed a ‘progressive and inclusive’ Bangladesh in letter to new PM: MEA
content: The Official Spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs Randhir Jaiswal said, “The letter underlined India’s commitment to supporting a democratic, progressive and inclusive Bangladesh”.

title: AI can help India achieve Viksit Bharat goal, but poses high risk to jobs: IMF chief
content: AI creates potential for countries that go fast on digital infrastructure, skills, and adoption of AI, and countries must embrace the opportunities, while being mindful of the risks, according to the IMF chief

title: Congress to organise farmers meetings on India-U.S. pact
content: First Kisan Sammelan to be held in Bhopal on Feb. 24; Cong. leaders say the pact will adversely affect cotton, soybean, maize and fruit growers

title: AI Summit drew $250bn investment commitments, 5 lakh visitors: Vaishnaw
content: A ‘Delhi Declaration’ on AI will be released on Saturday, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said, adding that more than 70 countries have signed it

title: Why US Supreme Court struck down Donald Trump's trade tariffs; explained in 10 points
content: The Supreme Court ruled that President Trump lacked the authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) to impose broad tariffs. The 6-3 decision found the law does not explicitly grant power for tariffs, a move Trump had used extensively. This ruling could lead to significant refunds and ongoing disputes over presidential tariff powers.

title: 'We failed': Australia star's painful dressing room confession after T20 World Cup exit
content: Despite a dominant nine-wicket victory over Oman and Adam Zampa's four-wicket haul, Australia's early exit from the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 cast a shadow.  Captain Mitchell Marsh also contributed a quickfire half-century, but individual performances offered little solace as the team expressed deep disappointment with their tournament's premature conclusion.

title: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh talks about AI tools replacing engineers
content: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh reassures that AI will augment, not decimate, IT jobs, projecting a thriving Indian IT industry by 2030. He highlights the need for engineering expertise to integrate AI into enterprises and notes a positive US business environment. Infosys continues campus hiring, anticipating increased demand for skilled professionals.

title: What a ‘good’ cholesterol test can still miss about your health: Doctor explains
content: Doctors caution that a seemingly 'normal' cholesterol report can be misleading. It's not just about the cholesterol levels; factors such as inflammation, LDL particle size, and triglycerides can dramatically influence your heart health. Genetics and lifestyle choices, often overlooked, are equally significant. A comprehensive heart health assessment goes far beyond cholesterol numbers alone.

title: Shaheen, Babar dropped after India defeat? Pak coach's verdict on 'paradigm shift'
content: Pakistan's head coach Mike Hesson rejected claims that dropping Shaheen Afridi and demoting Babar Azam against Namibia were reactions to their loss against India. Hesson stated these changes were tactical, aiming to optimize player roles and improve powerplay performance, with Babar's strike rate in that phase being a concern.

title: Who is Ranvir Sachdeva, youngest speaker at India AI Summit; meets Google, OpenAI CEOs
content: An eight-year-old technologist, Ranvir Sachdeva, is the youngest keynote speaker at the India AI Impact Summit 2026. He is discussing how ancient Indian philosophies connect with modern AI. Ranvir is also sharing his contributions to India's GDP and AI literacy through an Indian AI model. He has previously met global tech leaders and the UN Secretary-General.

title: Zomato delivery boy killed after speeding car rams bike in Delhi; driver held
content: A 25-year-old Zepto delivery executive tragically lost his life after his electric scooter was struck by a car in West Delhi's Tilak Nagar. Eyewitnesses reported the car hit the scooter from behind, causing fatal injuries. The 27-year-old driver, a Municipal Corporation contractor, has been taken into custody as police investigate the incident further.

title: 'Shocked': Only daughter of ex-Isro employee who killed wife, refuses to fly from US for funeral
content: A shocking incident unfolded in Bengaluru where a 70-year-old man killed his wife. He feared no one would care for her after his demise. The victim's daughter, residing in New Jersey, USA, refused to travel for legal procedures. An extended family member completed the formalities and performed the cremation.

title: Meta separates Quest VR ecosystem, refocuses horizon worlds on mobile
content: Meta is pivoting its metaverse strategy, shifting its Horizon Worlds app from VR to mobile to challenge Roblox and Fortnite. This move follows significant layoffs and financial losses in its Reality Labs division. While VR hardware development continues, the company is now prioritizing mobile user engagement and third-party VR app support, signaling a major strategic overhaul.

title: US envoy Sergio Gor: India committed to not buying Russian oil
content: US Ambassador Sergio Gor stated India committed to not buying Russian oil as President Trump seeks to end the Russia-Ukraine war. Gor also revealed active negotiations for India to procure Venezuelan oil, with an interim trade deal imminent. India's foreign ministry emphasized its energy policy is driven by national interest.

title: Israel launches strike on Lebanon; 10 dead including senior Hezbollah leader —video shows aftermath
content: Israeli air strikes in Lebanon's Bekaa Valley killed at least 12 and wounded 50, targeting Hezbollah command centres. A senior Hezbollah leader was reportedly among the dead. These strikes, among the deadliest recently, risk straining a fragile US-brokered ceasefire. Earlier, an Israeli strike in Sidon killed two Hamas members.

title: Alysa Liu Family: Father Arthur, surrogacy journey & siblings
content: Milano Cortina Winter Olympics gold medalist Alysa Liu is known for her success on the ice, but her life at home is just as special. The American figure skater grew up in a large and unique family in California. She is the oldest of five children. Her father, Arthur Liu, raised all five kids as a single parent. Alysa has often spoken about how important her family is to her life and career.

title: Dan Hooker posts savage meme amid Keekgrace cheating claims going viral
content: The New Zealand MMA fighter Dan Hooker has become the center of online attention after an unverified infidelity rumor began circulating on the social media. An Instagram influencer known as ‘Keekgrace’ accused the UFC lightweight of cheating and shared screenshots of alleged messages along with photos of the two together.

title: Tommaso Giacomel collapses during Olympic biathlon mass start
content: Tommaso Giacomel collapsed while leading the men’s 15km mass start at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Anterselva. The Italian star struggled with breathing and stopped the race. Coach Fabio Cianciana later confirmed he is fine and receiving treatment. Norway’s Johannes Dale-Skjevdal won gold. Giacomel still leaves the Games with a mixed relay silver medal.

title: T20 World Cup: Close calls, big statements: Associates make noise, will ICC listen?
content: Associate teams lit up the T20 World Cup with fearless cricket, pushing top sides to the edge in multiple thrillers. But crucial dropped catches and lack of big-match experience proved costly. With growing confidence and exposure through T20 franchise leagues, their message is clear: give us more opportunities and results will follow.

title: Shahid Kapoor's 'O Romeo' crosses Rs 75 crore worldwide
content: Shahid Kapoor's 'O Romeo' experienced a slow start to its second week, earning an estimated Rs 2.25 crore on its eighth day, its lowest collection yet. Despite a strong Valentine's Day opening, the film's numbers have dipped. It has garnered Rs 49.35 crore net domestically and Rs 75.

title: US-sanctioned Iran-linked oil tanker spent 8 days in Pak maritime boundary: FIR
content: An Iran-linked oil tanker, seized by the Indian Coast Guard, spent days in Pakistan's maritime boundary with its tracking systems off. The vessel, along with two others, was apprehended for alleged illegal oil smuggling and forgery. Investigations revealed ship-to-ship transfers of fuel and bitumen without informing authorities.

title: Lawrence aide made multiple threat calls to Ranveer: FIR
content: Actor Ranveer Singh received extortion threats for Rs 20 crore from Harry Boxer, a Canada-based aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.  The FIR states Boxer left voice notes demanding the sum after Singh's manager ignored calls. Security around Singh has been increased, and a lookout circular is issued for Boxer.

title: Ex-UP junior engineer, his wife get death for sexually abusing 33 boys, selling their videos
content: A Pocso court in UP's Banda has sentenced a former government engineer and his wife to death for sexually abusing 33 boys over a decade and selling videos of their torture on the dark web. The couple lured children with games and gifts, inflicting severe physical and psychological trauma.

title: Spin issue, dropped catches: Is India's 'best yet to come' in T20 World Cup?
content: Former India cricketer Sanjay Bangar believes the team's best is yet to come despite a steady group stage. He highlighted catching as an area for improvement and identified Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, and Jasprit Bumrah as crucial players for the Super Eight stage.

title: MHA forms 2nd empowered committee for Bengal to fast-track requests under CAA
content: The Union home ministry has formed a second empowered committee in West Bengal to expedite citizenship applications under the CAA. This move comes as the volume of applications has surged, particularly from the Matua community. The new committee, headed by the deputy registrar general, aims to share the workload and reduce processing times for eligible immigrants.

title: Meet Asha Sharma: Indian-origin executive named CEO of Microsoft Gaming
content: Microsoft has appointed Asha Sharma as the new CEO of its gaming division, succeeding Phil Spencer. Sharma, with a background in AI and platform leadership, aims to refocus on Xbox's core audience amidst industry challenges like slowing revenue and intense competition. This significant leadership shift signals a strategic reset for Xbox.

title: US Supreme Court strikes down Trump tariffs
content: The US Supreme Court has delivered a major blow to President Donald Trump's trade policy. In a significant 6-3 decision, the court declared his global tariffs illegal. Chief Justice John Roberts stated Trump lacked the authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. This ruling could lead to billions in tariff refunds. The decision impacts future executive actions on trade.

title: Saudi crude imports narrow gap with Russia, set to become biggest supplier
content: Saudi Arabia has temporarily become India's top crude oil supplier, with imports reaching their highest since November 2019.  February saw nearly 1-1.1 million barrels per day arriving from the West Asian nation, surpassing Russia. This shift occurs amid US pressure on India to reduce Russian crude purchases, though analysts anticipate a short-term stabilization.

title: Cash transactions at NH fee plazas may end from April 1
content: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is considering a complete discontinuation of cash payments at toll plazas nationwide from April 1. This move aims to further boost digital toll collection, with cash transactions already reduced to a mere 1%. The transition is expected to enhance commuting ease by improving lane throughput and reducing congestion.

title: Relying on decades-old rulings, SC acquits stepdad of 6-yr-old's murder
content: A six-year-old girl's murder case saw her stepfather acquitted by the Supreme Court. The court found the evidence weak, citing a botched investigation. The stepfather was the last person seen with the child. His statement leading to the discovery of her remains was deemed inadmissible. The court highlighted the lack of corpus delicti and specified time of death.

title: 'Not meant to last forever': MS Dhoni's IPL teammate announces divorce
content: The 26-year-old shared the update about his personal life through a post on Instagram on Friday (February 20), confirming that the marriage has legally ended. In the note, Rahul reflected on his experiences and what he learned over the years.

title: Explained: 5 reasons why NYT op-ed is saying it's 'India's century'
content: India is emerging as a significant global player, challenging the US-China bipolar narrative. With a younger population and faster growth than China, India is positioning itself as a "third pole" in a "multiplex" world. Its strategy of "multi-alignment" allows it to engage with multiple powers while maintaining strategic autonomy, leveraging its growing diaspora as a diplomatic asset.

title: 'Deeply disappointing': Trump goes on rant against SC ruling on tariffs - top quotes
content: President Trump expressed deep disappointment and shame over the Supreme Court's ruling deeming his reciprocal tariffs illegal. He accused the court of being swayed by foreign interests and a small political movement, calling some justices "fools and lapdogs" for their perceived disloyalty to the constitution. This decision significantly impacts the President's trade war strategy.

title: Canadiens may break rivalry taboo in trade deal with Maple Leafs
content: Despite their historic rivalry, the Canadiens and Maple Leafs might consider a trade before the March 6 deadline. Montreal seeks calculated reinforcements for their playoff push, while Toronto, facing a potential pivot to selling, could offer veteran depth. This strategic alignment could see rivals conduct rare business, benefiting both teams' competitive windows and asset management.

title: Re-think on trade deal? What US top court's ruling means for India
content: Trump had recently removed the 50% tariffs that he had imposed on India, bringing it down to 18%. An India-US joint statement on the same was issued earlier this month and an Indian delegation is travelling to the US in the coming days to finalise the interim trade deal.

title: Lower tariffs, revenue setback & more: What SC ruling means for Trump’s economic agenda
content: The Supreme Court of the United States on Friday said that President Donald Trump exceeded his legal authority by invoking emergency economic powers to levy tariffs — a rare reprimand that delivers a significant setback to his economic program.

title: Trump tariffs trashed: US businesses fret as court ruling 'worryingly silent' over refunds
content: US businesses have won a significant victory as the Supreme Court struck down President Trump's emergency tariffs. While companies anticipate billions in refunds, the process is expected to be lengthy and complex. The ruling, impacting over $175 billion in collected tariffs, has boosted markets, though uncertainty about future tariff policies remains.

title: 'US not at war with every nation': SC's sharp put down in ruling against Trump's illegal tariffs
content: The US Supreme Court has ruled against Donald Trump's global tariffs, stating the nation isn't at war with every country. The court found the administration relied solely on IEEPA, granting the President sweeping powers to impose unlimited tariffs on any product from any nation. This landmark judgment significantly curtails presidential trade authority.

title: Trump's tariffs illegal: US top court strikes down tariffs imposed across globe
content: The ruling is widely seen as the big blow to Donald Trump’s second administration at the conservative-leaning Supreme Court. Just last year, the bench had consistently backed the president through a string of emergency decisions related to immigration, the removal of independent agency heads, and sweeping reductions in federal spending.

title: India, Pakistan players 'talking behind closed doors': England legend amid handshake row
content: India-Pakistan rivalry has intensified, with India skipping post-match handshakes, sparking debate. The move began in the Asia Cup and was linked to security-related sentiments. Former England players discussed the issue, with Phil Tufnell and Michael Vaughan saying India look dominant and Pakistan appear intimidated. Alastair Cook suggested the tension may be for public display and players might be friendly in private.

title: Why were Trump tariffs ruled illegal by SC? Top points from big ruling
content: ​​The case marked the first significant element of Trump’s wide-ranging policy agenda to be directly reviewed by America’s highest court — an institution he influenced during his first term by appointing three conservative justices.

title: OPS calls on CM, says DMK stands a chance of retaining power
content: The general view is that the DMK regime’s achievements in last five years are entrenched in the minds of people, says the expelled AIADMK leader

title: Cash transactions at NH toll plazas likely to be discontinued
content: From April 1, 2026, NHAI may allow payments only through FASTag or Unified Payments Interface (UPI) at toll plazas

title: India participated as an ‘observer’ in Board of Peace meeting: MEA
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal reiterates India’s position on the Palestinian issue and says India stands for a “sovereign, independent, and viable State of Palestine based on 1967 borders”

title: PAC pulls up govt. for poorly planned implementation of ₹4,455‑crore SANKALP scheme
content: CAG flags sluggish financial progress, lack of preparedness; MPs question absence of central monitoring and roadmap for integrating skilling in schools

title: Madras High Court dismisses cases filed by PMK founder Ramadoss seeking to freeze ‘mango’ symbol
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say factional disputes can be resolved only through a civil court

title: Opposition’s allegations about Kerala’s health sector justified, says Satheesan
content: The lethargic attitude of the State Health department should be blamed for the recurrence of such incidents, the LoP said

title: Supreme Court asks judicial officers to be deployed for West Bengal SIR
content: Bench says ‘trust deficit’ and ‘unfortunate blame-game’ between Mamata govt. and EC threaten to stall the process; judicial officers will hear lakhs of voters missing from draft electoral roll

title: Officials told to appoint coordinators for space allocation in Amaravati buildings
content: Inputs on space requirements will be gathered before finalising allocations in the proposed Secretariat Complex, says Cabinet Sub-Committee

title: Navy delegates explore natural dyeing at Sankalpa Art Village
content: Delegates from nearly 50 countries take part in tie and dye workshop, interact with artisans and join Kolatam during International Fleet Review outreach programme

title: Assembly bypolls: Intense lobbying for ticket in Davangere South, Bagalkot
content: Muslim community leaders of the Congress are lobbying hard to get a ticket in Davangere South, while there is competition among Meti’s children in Bagalkot

title: BRS accuses govt. of stopping Devadula water lifting
content: Deputy Floor Leader of the party Harish Rao demands running all pumps to protect crops in over 3 lakh acres

title: SITRA in Coimbatore to set up laboratory for sportswear, athleisure wear
content: The Tamil Nadu government recently announced in its Interim Budget for 2026-27 that it will give ₹6 crore to SITRA to set up a laboratory

title: Draw of lots held for first phase of Wayanad rehabilitation project
content: In the initial phase, 178 houses have been constructed. Government order granting ownership (title deeds) of the houses along with seven cents of land distributed to beneficiaries

title: Gang involved in trafficking youth to Laos on pretext of overseas employment busted in Jagtial
content: The accused collected amounts ranging from ₹75,000 to ₹1,05,000 from each victim under the guise of “Call Centre Jobs in Bangkok”, police said

title: Kerala govt. enhances DA, DR to 35%
content: The enhanced dearness allowance and dearness relief will be disbursed along with the salary and pension disbursed in April

title: One third of excluded voters in Ernakulam appear back in the final roll as SIR concludes
content: While the draft electoral roll published on December 23, 2025, after the enumeration contained 23,30,643 voters, the fresh list, as of earlier this week when the revision was under way, had 24,62,641 voters

title: Compassionate teaching trumps AI in shaping future leaders: former Postal Service Board member
content: Uday Bala Krishnan says human empathy and broad minded mentoring remain central to nurturing scientific imagination and generating future job opportunities, beyond what Artificial Intelligence alone can achieve

title: Preparations in full swing for 2026 Assembly polls in Kerala
content: Senior officials of the Election Commission of India will assess the preparations on Sunday and Monday

title: All eligible families in Kerala will be granted priority ration cards: Minister G.R. Anil
content: Responding to reports claiming that 8,531 families, including extremely poor, were removed from priority list, Minister dismisses such reports as misleading and urges public not to be misled by incorrect information

title: Aquaculture tanks ‘resurface’ in Kolleru Wildlife Sanctuary after demolition drive
content: Aquaculture activities have resumed in around 5,000 acres of land that were cleared a few months ago during the anti-encroachment drive, say sources

title: 1,100 engineering students showcase projects at Resonance 2EK26
content: Technical fest at BVC Engineering College features project expo, robo race and AI interaction with industry leaders

title: Kerala Cabinet approves IT Policy 2026
content: Aim is to secure 10% of the country’s IT exports for the State, increase IT space and create 5 lakh new jobs

title: TDP leader hits back at YSRCP on Tirumala laddu issue
content: Findings emerging from the CBI inquiry expose a systemic administrative collapse under the previous YSRCP regime, says TDP State president Palla Srinivasa Rao

title: Army chief concludes four-day Australia visit, boosts bilateral military cooperation
content: General Upendra Dwivedi held extensive talks during the four-day visit from February 16 to 19 with senior leadership of the Australian defence forces to review bilateral engagements and expand army-to-army cooperation

title: Sabarimala gold theft: Court cites lack of evidence as reason for granting bail to Tantri
content: Court rules Tantri does not hold the authority to override the administrative decisions made by the TDB, a factor that weighed heavily in the decision to grant him bail

title: U.S. cruises to set up 'exciting' Canada showdown
content: Jack Hughes scored two goals, and the U.S. rolled into the final by routing Slovakia 6-2 in the semifinals Friday night. The U.S. will meet tournament favorite and top-seeded Canada on Sunday for the title.

title: Mayweather to unretire after Tyson exhibition
content: Former boxing superstar Floyd Mayweather Jr. says he is unretiring and will resume his undefeated career after his planned exhibition bout against Mike Tyson.

title: UCLA's Cronin apologizes to player for ejection
content: UCLA coach Mick Cronin said Friday he apologized to Steven Jamerson II for sending the center to the locker room late in a blowout loss at No. 15 Michigan State after he committed a hard foul.

title: VCU left with 4 players after late fracas with SLU
content: A chaotic, benches-clearing altercation in the final seconds of Friday's game between Saint Louis and VCU resulted in the Rams finishing the contest with only four players.

title: Hoiberg cites pacemaker as reason for fan incident
content: Nebraska coach Fred Hoiberg says there were circumstances surrounding his altercation with a court-storming Iowa fan that people viewing viral social media videos might not fully understand.

title: Hunter has surgery, Kings' latest out for season
content: De'Andre Hunter had surgery Friday to repair a detached retina in his left eye, becoming the third Kings player to undergo season-ending surgery in recent days.

title: Judge denies Tennessee QB Aguilar's eligibility bid
content: A judge has denied Tennessee quarterback Joey Aguilar's request for a preliminary injunction to play another season withe Volunteers, effectively ending his college career.

title: Sources: Prestianni told UEFA he used anti-gay slur
content: Gianluca Prestianni has already given evidence in UEFA's investigation into his alleged racist abuse of Vinícius Júnior, sources told ESPN.

title: The deepest -- and thinnest -- positions of the NFL offseason: Solak ranks all 11 spots
content: NFL teams looking for edge rusher help are in good shape, as the free agent and draft classes have options. But what about the other 10 positions?

title: Men's Bracketology: Houston unseats UConn as final No. 1 seed
content: The Cougars crack the top line after the Huskies' loss. Plus, how Miami (Ohio)'s fate could take shape.

title: Michigan rode supersized frontcourt to No. 1 ranking -- now it hopes a title is next
content: Starting lineups featuring three former centers? How Dusty May and the Wolverines cracked a winning code.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: How Wemby and the Spurs turned things around one year after a devastating diagnosis
content: One year after a blood clot ended his season, Victor Wembanyama has the Spurs bound for the playoffs.

title: NBA MVP straw poll 2.0: SGA, Jokic lead our update -- but chaos looms
content: With so many contenders in danger of missing the 65-game threshold, this race could take a sharp turn.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. men's hockey beats Slovakia in semis
content: Friday at the Olympics was headlined by the U.S. men's hockey team advancing to the gold medal round.

title: How Alysa Liu became the unlikeliest Olympic figure skating champion
content: Alysa Liu won Olympic gold on Thursday -- an unexpected fairy-tale ending to an up-and-down week for the U.S. figure skating team.

title: College football's 100 best quarterbacks of the 2000s
content: Make way for Fernando Mendoza and others on Bill Connelly's updated list of the greatest quarterbacks of the century.

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Does Marte's offense put him on top? Or does Hoerner's elite defense make him No. 1? Here's how our list shakes out.

title: Ranking the top 10 first basemen in MLB: Is Vlad Jr. or Kurtz No. 1?
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: Top 50 USMNT players of 2026, ranked by club form: Which Americans made the top 10?
content: Who are the 50 best American players of 2026 so far? The top 10 sees a shake-up as the USMNT Player Performance Index returns.

title: Bracketology: Can red-hot Duke get to a No. 2 seed?
content: The Blue Devils have won 17 consecutive games. They're undefeated in ACC play. But they remain a 3-seed.

title: Power Rankings: How the Terps returned to the top 16
content: After riding a four-game losing streak into February, the Terps have turned it around, winning four in a row.

title: Why are managers watching games from the stands? Rugby holds the answer
content: Europe's biggest international rugby competition is underway, and for the likes of Luis Enrique and Mikel Arteta, the sport has been a source of inspiration.

title: MLS team-by-team preview: Why is 2026 your team's year?
content: With the 2026 MLS season kicking off Saturday, ESPN breaks down where the league's 30 clubs stand and how they've prepped for a run at MLS Cup.

title: How Claressa Shields turned notoriety into main event fame
content: Boxer Claressa Shields, undefeated in the ring and undaunted online, has finally found the fame she always wanted. But at what price?

title: Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia: Picks, predictions, more
content: Two fighters and two trainers share their analysis and predictions for the Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia title fight.

title: F1 predicted running order for 2026: Who is on top of the new cars?
content: With six days of testing in Bahrain now complete, ESPN pores over the data and speaks with paddock sources to predict F1's running order for 2026.

title: Have F1’s regulations for 2026 made the sport too complicated?
content: F1's star drivers have spent much of preseason criticizing the sport's new-for-2026 cars. They might have a point, but there are no simple solutions.

title: Risers and fallers: Tristan Vukcevic, Jarace Walker making the most of playing time
content: Should fantasy basketball managers keep or trade players like Tristan Vukcevic, Pascal Siakam and others?

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG inform Man City of Haaland interest
content: Paris Saint-Germain have asked Manchester City to let them know if Erling Haaland ever becomes available. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Delivery Boy Killed By Speeding Car In Delhi, Accused Arrested
content: A delivery boy lost his life after being allegedly hit by a speeding car in the Subhash Nagar area of West Delhi in the early hours of Saturday, Delhi police said.

title: Trump Tariffs Live Updates: Trump Signs 10% Global Tariffs Order After Supreme Court Ruling
content: Trump Tariffs Live Updates: US trading partners that reached tariff deals with Trump's administration will now also face a 10 per cent duty, despite higher levels they may have agreed on previously, the White House said.

title: "Love His Vision On AI": OpenAI's Sam Altman After Meeting PM Modi
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision on Artificial Intelligence, while noting the excitement regarding the technology in India.

title: 5 Months After Love Marriage, UP Couple Dies By Suicide Hours Apart
content: An inter-caste couple who had married out of love around five months ago were found hanging at their residence in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur district, with police suspecting they died by suicide within hours of each other, an official said on Friday.

title: 'Nothing Changes': Trump's Big Claim On India-US Trade Deal After Tariff Blow
content: The India-US trade "deal is on," said Donald Trump, even as the United States Supreme Court ruled that the American president's sweeping emergency tariffs are illegal.

title: "Adjustment Begins": Trump Signs 10% Global Tariffs After US Top Court Setback
content: Donald Trump lashed out at the Supreme Court for striking down much of his sweeping tariffs, saying he was "ashamed" and called the ruling "deeply disappointing".

title: Meet Neal Katyal, Indian-American Lawyer Who Argued Against Trump's Tariffs
content: The son of Indian immigrants who once served as America's top courtroom advocate has emerged as the face of a landmark Supreme Court judgement that overthrew President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.

title: "Fools And Lapdogs": Trump's All-Out Attack On Judges After Tariffs Order
content: Speaking at the White House after the Supreme Court ruled his global tariffs illegal, US President Donald Trump said that the ruling was "deeply disappointing".

title: Explained: What's Next After US Supreme Court Ruling On Trump's Tariffs
content: The Supreme Court's striking down of President Donald Trump's global tariffs, while a relief to many, heralds more months of uncertainty as US businesses brace for new levies and a fight for refunds plays out.

title: 'Big Loss For Someone Who Never Admits Losing': Experts On Trump's Tariff Setback
content: The US Supreme Court has declared illegal Donald Trump's broad global tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.

title: "Some People Think...": Tejashwi Yadav Hits Back At BJP's Maithili Thakur
content: RJD working president Tejashwi Yadav on Friday slammed singer-turned-politician Maithili Thakur for her remarks about his party's rule in Bihar.

title: Traffic Curbs In Delhi On Last Day Of AI Summit, Check Routes To Avoid
content: Delhi Police has issued a traffic advisory announcing special arrangements on several key roads in New Delhi today in view of the AI Impact Summit at Bharat Mandapam, an official said.

title: RSS Not Seeking Power, Focused On Uniting Hindu Society: Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh is not driven by any desire for political power and is solely committed to organising the entire Hindu society and fostering character-building among individuals.

title: Trump Signs 10% Global Tariffs Order After Supreme Court Ruling
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday signed off on a global 10-percent tariff "on all Countries," hours after the Supreme Court ruled his levies on imports are illegal.

title: US Congress Plans To Block Trump From Attacking Iran Amid Tensions
content: The US Congress could vote as soon as next week on whether to block President Donald Trump's ability to strike Iran without lawmakers' approval, as the US military prepares for a potential serious conflict with Iran if diplomatic efforts fail.

title: Key Takeaways From Trump's Press Conference Over Court Tariff Ruling
content: Trump used an expansive and combative news conference to respond to a Supreme Court judgment that curtailed his use of a key tariff authority, turning what might have been a defensive moment into an aggressive reaffirmation of his trade doctrine.

title: Trump To Visit China From March 31 To April 2 For Trade Talks
content: A White House official confirmed that US President Donald Trump is set to visit China from March 31 to April 2, a move that China sees as a win, as the world is bracing to witness a churn in the global order.

title: What To Know About Supreme Court Ruling On Tariffs
content: The Supreme Court dealt President Donald Trump a bruising loss on a cornerstone of his economic policy, striking down sweeping tariffs he imposed on nearly every country.

title: In Trump Speech, Alternative Tariff Routes, Praise For Judges Who Dissented
content: US President Donald Trump made his first public remarks after the Supreme Court dealt a major blow to his economic policy on Friday, ruling that he had exceeded his authority when he imposed tariffs on nearly every US trading partner.

title: US Supreme Court Strikes Down Global Tariffs, Trump Fumes
content: In a major blow to US President Donald Trump, the Supreme Court struck down tariffs on Friday. The court ruled that Trump exceeded his authority when he imposed sweeping tariffs.

title: Top moments: United States wins gold medal game over Canada in overtime
content: Emily Kaplan looks ahead to the U.S. women's hockey team's gold medal game against Canada. (0:43) It all came down to this at the 2026 Olympic Games for the two most dominant countries in international women's hockey. The United States and Canada faced off Thursday for the gold medal. After a thrilling back-and-forth game, the U.S. won 2-1 in overtime on a goal by Megan Keller. Women's ice hockey was first introduced at the Olympics in 1998, and these are the only two countries to have won Olympic gold since. Canada won gold four years ago in Beijing, but the U.S. swept this winter's Rivalry Series and defeated Canada 5-0 in the preliminary round. More:   U.S.-Canada is the rematch everyone wanted   |  U.S. favored in gold medal game Here are all the goals and top moments from the game.

title: How Eileen Gu competing for China is all American

title: How Premier League clubs look to U.S. to fund big-money signings
